meanings.definition: To surpass in service or performance.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outserve her coworkers by going above and beyond in her tasks.
meanings.sent2: The new restaurant aims to outserve its competitors by providing exceptional customer service.
meanings.sent3: The friendly competition between the two friends led them to constantly try to outserve each other in helping out around the house.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to outserve others in his community made him a well-respected figure.
meanings.sent5: The young athlete's determination to outserve his opponents propelled him to victory.

meanings.definition: To serve better or more effectively than someone else.
meanings.sent1: In order to outserve the competition, the small business focused on personalized customer experiences.
meanings.sent2: The charity organization strives to outserve other similar groups by efficiently distributing resources to those in need.
meanings.sent3: The siblings engaged in a friendly rivalry to outserve each other in household chores.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outserve her colleagues earned her the Employee of the Month award.
meanings.sent5: The dedicated volunteer always goes the extra mile to outserve the community.
